protocol.name: P-AFFY-2
protocol.text: Labeling of samples was carried out according to the manufacturerâ€™s standard protocol

text: Wild-type Col-0 plants were grown for 4d in a UV-B-supplemented light field (Osram L18W/30 and Philips TL20W/01RS) under a 3-mm cut-off filter of the WG series (Schott, Mainz, Germany) with half-maximal transmission at 345 nm (i.e. UV-B minus). This 345 nm cut-off was exchanged with a 305 nm cut-off at 6h before harvesting (i.e. 6h +UV-B); UV-B fluence rate: 1.5 micromole m-2 s-1, photosynthetically active radiation: 3.3 micromole m-2 s-1.
(Parameters: start time = 4, time unit = days, min temperature = 18, max temperature = 23, temperature unit = C, media = Murashige and Skoog)

protocol.text: Plants were grown for 4d in a UV-B-supplemented light field (Osram L18W/30 and Philips TL20W/01RS) under a 3-mm cut-off filter of the WG series (Schott, Mainz, Germany) with half-maximal transmission at 345 nm (i.e. UV-B). This 345 nm cut-off was exchanged with a 305 nm cut-off at 1h before harvesting (i.e. 1h +UV-B); UV-B fluence rate: 1.5 micromole m-2 s-1, photosynthetically active radiation: 3.3 micromole m-2 s-1.

text: cop1 mutant plants are grown in continuous white light supplemented with low-level UV-B radiation. We make use of cut-off filters to generate different radiation conditions in the UV-B wavelength region. On one hand a 345 nm cut-off filter is used to free the incident radiation from UV-B (i.e. UV-B minus control) whereas a 305 nm cut off filter is used to analyse response to UV-B (i.e. +UV-B sample). Continuous and short-time supplementary UV-B irradiation of Arabidopsis cop1 mutant seedlings will be compared. Our experimental setup allows identical conditions for all samples in the same light field, varying only the UV-B component: -UV-B control 0) 4 days under 345 nm cut-off +UV-B samples: 4d under 305 nm cut-off.
(Parameters: start time = 4, time unit = days, min temperature = 18, max temperature = 23, temperature unit = C, media = Murashige and Skoog)

Arabidopsis RNA was isolated with the Plant RNeasy kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
(Parameters: Extracted product = total_RNA, Amplification = none)
